title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: For every house has a builder; but the builder of all things is God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And Moses certainly kept faith as a servant, in all his house, and as a witness of those things which were to be said later;

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: But Christ as a son, over his house; whose house are we, if we keep our hearts fixed in the glad and certain hope till the end.

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And so, as the Holy Spirit says, Today if you let his voice come to your ears,

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Be not hard of heart, as when you made me angry, on the day of testing in the waste land,

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: When your fathers put me to the test, and saw my works for forty years.

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: So that I was angry with this generation, and I said, Their hearts are in error at all times, and they have no knowledge of my ways;

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And being angry I made an oath, saying, They may not come into my rest.

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: My brothers, take care that there is not by chance in any one of you an evil heart without belief, turning away from the living God:

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: But give comfort to one another every day as long as it is still Today; so that no one among you may be made hard by the deceit of sin:

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: For if we keep the substance of the faith which we had at the start, even till the end, we have a part with Christ;

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: As it is said, Today if you will let his voice come to your ears, be not hard of heart, as when you made him angry.

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Who made him angry when his voice came to them? was it not all those who came out of Egypt with Moses?

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: And with whom was he angry for forty years? was it not with those who did evil, who came to their deaths in the waste land?

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And to whom did he make an oath that they might not come into his rest? was it not to those who went against his orders?

title: Hebrews Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: So we see that they were not able to go in because they had no belief.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: Let us then, though we still have God's word that we may come into his rest, go in fear that some of you may be unable to do so.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: And, truly, the good news came to us, even as it did to them; but the hearing of the word did them no good, because they were not united in faith with the true hearers.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: For those of us who have belief come into his rest; even as he has said, As I said in my oath when I was angry, They may not come into my rest: though the works were done from the time of the making of the world.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: For in one place he has said of the seventh day, And God had rest from all his works on the seventh day;

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: And in the same place he says again, They will not come into my rest.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: So that as it is clear that some have to go in, and that the first hearers of the good news were not able to go in because they went against God's orders,

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: After a long time, again naming a certain day, he says in David, Today (as he had said before), Today if you will let his voice come to your ears, be not hard of heart,

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not have said anything about another day.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: So that there is still a Sabbath-keeping for the people of God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: For the man who comes into his rest has had rest from his works, as God did from his.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Because of this, let us have a strong desire to come into that rest, and let no one go after the example of those who went against God's orders.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: For the word of God is living and full of power, and is sharper than any two-edged sword, cutting through and making a division even of the soul and the spirit, the bones and the muscles, and quick to see the thoughts and purposes of the heart.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: And there is nothing made which is not completely clear to him; there is nothing covered, but all things are open to the eyes of him with whom we have to do.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: Having then a great high priest, who has made his way through the heavens, even Jesus the Son of God, let us be strong in our faith.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: For we have not a high priest who is not able to be touched by the feelings of our feeble flesh; but we have one who has been tested in all points as we ourselves are tested, but without sin.

title: Hebrews Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: Then let us come near to the seat of grace without fear, so that mercy may be given to us, and we may get grace for our help in time of need.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Every high priest who is taken from among men is given his position to take care of the interests of men in those things which have to do with God, so that he may make offerings for sins.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: He is able to have feeling for those who have no knowledge and for those who are wandering from the true way, because he himself is feeble;

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: And being feeble, he has to make sin-offerings for himself as well as for the people.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: And no man who is not given authority by God, as Aaron was, takes this honour for himself.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: In the same way Christ did not take for himself the glory of being made a high priest, but was given it by him who said, You are my Son, this day I have given you being:

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: As he says in another place, You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Who in the days of his flesh, having sent up prayers and requests with strong crying and weeping to him who was able to give him salvation from death, had his prayer answered because of his fear of God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: And though he was a Son, through the pain which he underwent, the knowledge came to him of what it was to be under God's orders;

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: And when he had been made complete, he became the giver of eternal salvation to all those who are under his orders;

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Being named by God a high priest of the order of Melchizedek.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: Of whom we have much to say which it is hard to make clear, because you are slow of hearing.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: And though by this time it would be right for you to be teachers, you still have need of someone to give you teaching about the first simple rules of God's revelation; you have become like babies who have need of milk, and not of solid food.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: For everyone who takes milk is without experience of the word of righteousness: he is a child.

title: Hebrews Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: But solid food is for men of full growth, even for those whose senses are trained by use to see what is good and what is evil.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 1
text: For this reason let us go on from the first things about Christ to full growth; not building again that on which it is based, that is, the turning of the heart from dead works, and faith in God,

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 2
text: The teaching of baptisms, and of the putting on of hands, and of the future life of the dead, and of the judging on the last day.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 3
text: Now we will do this, if God lets us.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 4
text: As for those who at one time saw the light, tasting the good things from heaven, and having their part in the Holy Spirit,

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 5
text: With knowledge of the good word of God, and of the powers of the coming time,

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 6
text: And then let themselves be turned away, it is not possible for their hearts to be made new a second time; because they themselves put the Son of God on the cross again, openly shaming him.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 7
text: For a land, drinking in the frequent rain and producing good plants for those for whom it is worked, has a blessing from God:

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 8
text: But if it sends up thorns and evil plants, it is of no use and is ready to be cursed; its only end is to be burned.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 9
text: But, my loved ones, though we say this, we are certain that you have better things in you, things which go with salvation;

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 10
text: For God is true, and will not put away from him the memory of your work and of your love for his name, in the help which you gave and still give to the saints.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 11
text: And it is our desire that you may all keep the same high purpose in certain hope to the end:

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 12
text: So that you may not be slow in heart, but may take as your example those to whom God has given their heritage, because of their faith and their long waiting.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 13
text: For when God made his oath to Abraham, because there was no greater oath, he made it by himself,

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 14
text: Saying, Be certain that I will give you my blessing, and make your numbers very great.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 15
text: And so, when he had been waiting calmly for a long time, God's word to him was put into effect.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 16
text: For men at all times make their oaths by what is greater; and any argument is ended by the decision of the oath.

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 17
text: So that when it was God's desire to make it specially clear to those who by his word were to have the heritage, that his purpose was fixed, he made it more certain with an oath;

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 18
text: So that we, who have gone in flight from danger to the hope which has been put before us, may have a strong comfort in two unchanging things, in which it is not possible for God to be false;

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 19
text: And this hope is like a strong band for our souls, fixed and certain, and going in to that which is inside the veil;

title: Hebrews Chapter 6 Verse 20
text: Where Jesus has gone before us, as a high priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 1
text: For this Melchizedek, the king of Salem, a priest of the Most High God, who gave Abraham his blessing, meeting him when he came back after putting the kings to death,

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 2
text: And to whom Abraham gave a tenth part of everything which he had, being first named King of righteousness, and then in addition, King of Salem, that is to say, King of peace;

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 3
text: Being without father or mother, or family, having no birth or end to his life, being made like the Son of God, is a priest for ever.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 4
text: Now see how great this man was, to whom our father Abraham gave a tenth part of what he had got in the fight.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 5
text: And it is true that by the law, those of the sons of Levi who have the position of priests may take a tenth part of the people's goods; that is to say, they take it from their brothers though these are the sons of Abraham.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 6
text: But this man, who was not of their family, took the tenth from Abraham, and gave a blessing to him to whom God had given his undertaking.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 7
text: But there is no doubt that the less gets his blessing from the greater.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 8
text: Now at the present time, men over whom death has power take the tenth; but then it was taken by one of whom it is witnessed that he is living.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 9
text: And we may say that in Abraham, even Levi, who has a right to take the tenth part, gave it;

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 10
text: Because he was still in his father's body when Melchizedek came to him.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 11
text: Now if it was possible for things to be made complete through the priests of the house of Levi (for the law was given to the people in connection with them), what need was there for another priest who was of the order of Melchizedek and not of the order of Aaron?

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 12
text: Because if the priests are changed, it is necessary to make a change in the law.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 13
text: For he of whom these things are said comes of another tribe, of which no man has ever made offerings at the altar.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 14
text: Because it is clear that our Lord comes out of Judah, and Moses said nothing about priests from that tribe.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 15
text: And this is even more clear if a second priest has come up who is like Melchizedek,

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 16
text: That is to say, not made by a law based on the flesh, but by the power of a life without end:

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 17
text: For it has been witnessed of him, You are a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 18
text: So the law which went before is put on one side, because it was feeble and without profit.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 19
text: (Because the law made nothing complete), and in its place there is a better hope, through which we come near to God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 20
text: And as this is not without the taking of an oath

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 21
text: (For those were made priests without an oath, but this one was made a priest with an oath by him who says of him, The Lord gave his oath, which he will not take back, that you are a priest for ever);

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 22
text: By so much is it a better agreement which we have through Jesus.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 23
text: And it is true that there have been a great number of those priests, because death does not let them go on for ever;

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 24
text: But this priest, because his life goes on for ever, is unchanging.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 25
text: So that he is fully able to be the saviour of all who come to God through him, because he is ever living to make prayer to God for them.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 26
text: It was right for us to have such a high priest, one who is holy and without evil, doing no wrong, having no part with sinners, and made higher than the heavens:

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 27
text: Who has no need to make offerings for sins every day, like those high priests, first for himself, and then for the people; because he did this once and for ever when he made an offering of himself.

title: Hebrews Chapter 7 Verse 28
text: The law makes high priests of men who are feeble; but the word of the oath, which was made after the law, gives that position to a Son, in whom all good is for ever complete.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 1
text: Now of the things we are saying this is the chief point: We have such a high priest, who has taken his place at the right hand of God's high seat of glory in heaven,

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 2
text: As a servant of the holy things and of the true Tent, which was put up by God, not by man.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 3
text: Now every high priest is given authority to take to God the things which are given and to make offerings; so that it is necessary for this man, like them, to have something for an offering.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 4
text: If he had been on earth he would not have been a priest at all, because there are other priests who make the offerings ordered by the law;

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 5
text: Being servants of that which is a copy and an image of the things in heaven, as Moses, when he was about to make the Tent, had special orders from God: for, See, he said, that you make everything like the design which you saw in the mountain.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 6
text: But now his position as priest is higher. because through him God has made a better agreement with man, based on the giving of better things.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 7
text: For if that first agreement had been as good as possible, there would have been no place for a second.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 8
text: For, protesting against them, he says, See, the days are coming when I will make a new agreement with the house of Israel, and with the house of Judah;

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 9
text: Not like the agreement which I made with their fathers when I took them by the hand, to be their guide out of the land of Egypt; for they did not keep the agreement with me, and I gave them up, says the Lord.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 10
text: For this is the agreement which I will make with the people of Israel after those days: I will put my laws into their minds, writing them in their hearts: and I will be their God, and they will be my people:

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 11
text: And there will be no need for every man to be teaching his brother, or his neighbour, saying, This is the knowledge of the Lord: for they will all have knowledge of me, great and small.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 12
text: And I will have mercy on their evil-doing, and I will not keep their sins in mind.

title: Hebrews Chapter 8 Verse 13
text: When he says, A new agreement, he has made the first agreement old. But anything which is getting old and past use will not be seen much longer.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 1
text: Now the first agreement had its rules of worship, and a holy order.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 2
text: For the first Tent was made ready, having in it the vessels for the lights and the table and the ordering of the bread; and this is named the holy place.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 3
text: And inside the second veil was the place which is named the Holy of holies;

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 4
text: Having a vessel of gold in it for burning perfumes, and the ark of the agreement, which was covered with gold and which had in it a pot made of gold for the manna, and Aaron's rod which put out buds, and the stones with the writing of the agreement;

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 5
text: And over it were the winged ones of glory with their wings covering the mercy-seat; about which it is not possible now to say anything in detail.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 6
text: Now while these things were in existence, the priests went into the first Tent at all times, for prayer and the making of offerings.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 7
text: But only the high priest went into the second, once a year, not without making an offering of blood for himself and for the errors of the people:

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 8
text: The Holy Spirit witnessing by this that the way into the holy place had not at that time been made open, while the first Tent was still in being;

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 9
text: And this is an image of the present time; when the offerings which are given are not able to make the heart of the worshipper completely clean,

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 10
text: Because they are only rules of the flesh, of meats and drinks and washings, which have their place till the time comes when things will be put right.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 11
text: But now Christ has come as the high priest of the good things of the future, through this greater and better Tent, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this world,

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 12
text: And has gone once and for ever into the holy place, having got eternal salvation, not through the blood of goats and young oxen, but through his blood.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 13
text: For if the blood of goats and oxen, and the dust from the burning of a young cow, being put on the unclean, make the flesh clean:

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 14
text: How much more will the blood of Christ, who, being without sin, made an offering of himself to God through the Holy Spirit, make your hearts clean from dead works to be servants of the living God?

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 15
text: And for this cause it is through him that a new agreement has come into being, so that after the errors under the first agreement had been taken away by his death, the word of God might have effect for those who were marked out for an eternal heritage.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 16
text: Because where there is a testament, there has to be the death of the man who made it.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 17
text: For a testament has effect after death; for what power has it while the man who made it is living?

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 18
text: So that even the first agreement was not made without blood.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 19
text: For when Moses had given all the rules of the law to the people, he took the blood of goats and young oxen, with water and red wool and hyssop, and put it on the book itself and on all the people,

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 20
text: Saying, This blood is the sign of the agreement which God has made with you.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 21
text: And the blood was put on the Tent and all the holy vessels in the same way.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 22
text: And by the law almost all things are made clean with blood, and without blood there is no forgiveness.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 23
text: For this cause it was necessary to make the copies of the things in heaven clean with these offerings; but the things themselves are made clean with better offerings than these.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 24
text: For Christ did not go into a holy place which had been made by men's hands as the copy of the true one; but he went into heaven itself, and now takes his place before the face of God for us.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 25
text: And he did not have to make an offering of himself again and again, as the high priest goes into the holy place every year with blood which is not his;

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 26
text: For then he would have undergone a number of deaths from the time of the making of the world: but now he has come to us at the end of the old order, to put away sin by the offering of himself.

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 27
text: And because by God's law death comes to men once, and after that they are judged;

title: Hebrews Chapter 9 Verse 28
text: So Christ, having at his first coming taken on himself the sins of men, will be seen a second time, without sin, by those who are waiting for him, for their salvation.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 1
text: For the law, being only a poor copy of the future good things, and not the true image of those things, is never able to make the people who come to the altar every year with the same offerings completely clean.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 2
text: For if this had been possible, would there not have been an end of those offerings, because the worshippers would have been made completely clean and would have been no longer conscious of sins?

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 3
text: But year by year there is a memory of sins in those offerings.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 4
text: Because it is not possible for the blood of oxen and goats to take away sins.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 5
text: So that when he comes into the world, he says, You had no desire for offerings, but you made a body ready for me;

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 6
text: You had no joy in burned offerings or in offerings for sin.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 7
text: Then I said, See, I have come to do your pleasure, O God (as it is said of me in the roll of the book).

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 8
text: After saying, You had no desire for offerings, for burned offerings or offerings for sin (which are made by the law) and you had no pleasure in them,

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 9
text: Then he said, See, I have come to do your pleasure. He took away the old order, so that he might put the new order in its place.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 10
text: By that pleasure we have been made holy, by the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once and for ever.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 11
text: And every priest takes his place at the altar day by day, doing what is necessary, and making again and again the same offerings which are never able to take away sins.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 12
text: But when Jesus had made one offering for sins for ever, he took his place at the right hand of God;

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 13
text: And has been waiting there from that time, till all who are against him are made a foot-rest for his feet.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 14
text: Because by one offering he has made complete for ever those who are made holy.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 15
text: And the Holy Spirit is a witness for us: for after he had said,

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 16
text: This is the agreement which I will make with them after those days, says the Lord; I will put my laws in their hearts, writing them in their minds; he said,

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 17
text: And I will keep no more memory of their sins and of their evil-doings.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 18
text: Now where there is forgiveness of these, there is no more offering for sin.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 19
text: So then, my brothers, being able to go into the holy place without fear, because of the blood of Jesus,

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 20
text: By the new and living way which he made open for us through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 21
text: And having a great priest over the house of God,

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 22
text: Let us go in with true hearts, in certain faith, having our hearts made free from the sense of sin and our bodies washed with clean water:

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 23
text: Let us keep the witness of our hope strong and unshaking, for he is true who has given his word:

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 24
text: And let us be moving one another at all times to love and good works;

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 25
text: Not giving up our meetings, as is the way of some, but keeping one another strong in faith; and all the more because you see the day coming near.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 26
text: For if we do evil on purpose after we have had the knowledge of what is true, there is no more offering for sins,

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 27
text: But only a great fear of being judged, and of the fire of wrath which will be the destruction of the haters of God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 28
text: A man who has gone against the law of Moses is put to death without pity on the word of two or three witnesses:

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 29
text: But will not the man by whom the Son of God has been crushed under foot, and the blood of the agreement with which he was washed clean has been taken as an unholy thing, and who has had no respect for the Spirit of grace, be judged bad enough for a very much worse punishment?

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 30
text: For we have had experience of him who says, Punishment is mine, I will give reward. And again, The Lord will be judge of his people.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 31
text: We may well go in fear of falling into the hands of the living God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 32
text: But give thought to the days after you had seen the light, when you went through a great war of troubles;

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 33
text: In part, in being attacked by angry words and cruel acts, before the eyes of everyone, and in part, in being united with those who were attacked in this way.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 34
text: For you had pity on those who were in prison, and had joy in the loss of your property, in the knowledge that you still had a better property and one which you would keep for ever.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 35
text: So do not give up your hope which will be greatly rewarded.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 36
text: For, having done what was right in God's eyes, you have need of waiting before his word has effect for you.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 37
text: In a very little time he who is coming will come; he will not be slow.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 38
text: But the upright man will be living by his faith; and if he goes back, my soul will have no pleasure in him.

title: Hebrews Chapter 10 Verse 39
text: But we are not of those who go back to destruction; but of those who have faith even to the salvation of the soul.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 1
text: Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, and the sign that the things not seen are true.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 2
text: For by it our fathers had God's approval.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 3
text: By faith it is clear to us that the order of events was fixed by the word of God, so that what is seen has not been made from things which only seem to be.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 4
text: By faith Abel made a better offering to God than Cain, and he had witness through it of his righteousness, God giving his approval of his offering: and his voice still comes to us through it though he is dead.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 5
text: By faith Enoch was taken up to heaven so that he did not see death; he was seen no longer, for God took him away: for before he was taken, witness had been given that he was well-pleasing to God:

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 6
text: And without faith it is not possible to be well-pleasing to him, for it is necessary for anyone who comes to God to have the belief that God is, and that he is a rewarder of all those who make a serious search for him.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 7
text: By faith Noah, being moved by the fear of God, made ready an ark for the salvation of his family, because God had given him news of things which were not seen at the time; and through it the world was judged by him, and he got for his heritage the righteousness which is by faith.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 8
text: By faith Abraham did as God said when he was ordered to go out into a place which was to be given to him as a heritage, and went out without knowledge of where he was going.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 9
text: By faith he was a wanderer in the land of the agreement, as in a strange land, living in tents with Isaac and Jacob, who had a part with him in the same heritage:

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 10
text: For he was looking for the strong town, whose builder and maker is God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 11
text: And by faith Sarah herself had power to give birth, when she was very old, because she had faith in him who gave his word;

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 12
text: So that from one man, who was near to death, came children in number as the stars in heaven, or as the sand by the seaside, which may not be numbered.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 13
text: All these came to their end in faith, not having had the heritage; but having seen it with delight far away, they gave witness that they were wanderers and not of the earth.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 14
text: For those who say such things make it clear that they are searching for a country for themselves.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 15
text: And truly if they had kept in mind the country from which they went out, they would have had chances of turning back.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 16
text: But now their desire is for a better country, that is to say, for one in heaven; and so it is no shame to God to be named their God; for he has made ready a town for them.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 17
text: By faith Abraham made an offering of Isaac, when he was tested: and he with whom the agreement had been made gave up as an offering the only son of his body,

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 18
text: Of whom it had been said, From Isaac will your seed take their name:

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 19
text: Judging that God was able to give life even to the dead; and because of this he did get him back as if from death.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 20
text: By faith Isaac, blessing Jacob and Esau, gave news of things to come.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 21
text: By faith Jacob gave a blessing to the two sons of Joseph, when he was near to death; and gave God worship, supported by his stick.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 22
text: By faith Joseph, when his end was near, said that the children of Israel would go out of Egypt; and gave orders about his bones.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 23
text: By faith Moses was kept secretly by his father and mother for three months after his birth, because they saw that he was a fair child; and they had no fear of the king's orders.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 24
text: By faith Moses, when he became a man, had no desire to be named the son of Pharaoh's daughter;

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 25
text: Feeling that it was better to undergo pain with the people of God, than for a short time to have a taste of the pleasures of sin;

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 26
text: Judging a part in the shame of Christ to be better than all the wealth of Egypt; for he was looking forward to his reward.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 27
text: By faith he went out of Egypt, not being turned from his purpose by fear of the wrath of the king; for he kept on his way, as seeing him who is unseen.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 28
text: By faith he kept the Passover, and put the sign of the blood on the houses, so that the angel of destruction might not put their oldest sons to death.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 29
text: By faith they went through the Red Sea as if it had been dry land, though the Egyptians were overcome by the water when they made an attempt to do the same.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 30
text: By faith the walls of Jericho came down, after they had been circled for seven days.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 31
text: By faith Rahab, the loose woman, was not put to death with those who had gone against God's orders, because she had taken into her house in peace those sent to see the land.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 32
text: What more am I to say? For there would not be time to give the stories of Gideon, Barak, Samson, and Jephthah, of David and Samuel and the prophets:

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 33
text: Who through faith overcame kingdoms, did righteousness, got their reward, kept the mouths of lions shut,

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 34
text: Put out the power of fire, got safely away from the edge of the sword, were made strong when they had been feeble, became full of power in war, and put to flight the armies of the nations.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 35
text: Women had their dead given back to them living; others let themselves be cruelly attacked, having no desire to go free, so that they might have a better life to come;

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 36
text: And others were tested by being laughed at or by blows, and even with chains and prisons:

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 37
text: They were stoned, they were cut up with knives, they were tested, they were put to death with the sword, they went about in sheepskins and in goatskins; being poor and in pain and cruelly attacked,

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 38
text: Wandering in waste places and in mountains and in holes in the rocks; for whom the world was not good enough.

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 39
text: And not one of these got the good things of the agreement, though they all had a good record through faith,

title: Hebrews Chapter 11 Verse 40
text: Because God had kept some better thing for us, so that it was not possible for them to become complete without us.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 1
text: For this reason, as we are circled by so great a cloud of witnesses, putting off every weight, and the sin into which we come so readily, let us keep on running in the way which is marked out for us,

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 2
text: Having our eyes fixed on Jesus, the guide and end of our faith, who went through the pains of the cross, not caring for the shame, because of the joy which was before him, and who has now taken his place at the right hand of God's seat of power.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 3
text: Give thought to him who has undergone so much of the hate of sinners against himself, so that you may not be tired and feeble of purpose.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 4
text: Till now you have not given your blood in your fight against sin:

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 5
text: And you have not kept in mind the word which says to you as to sons, My son, do not make little of the Lord's punishment, and do not give up hope when you are judged by him;

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 6
text: For the Lord sends punishment on his loved ones; everyone whom he takes as his son has experience of his rod.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 7
text: It is for your training that you undergo these things; God is acting to you as a father does to his sons; for what son does not have punishment from his father?

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 8
text: But if you have not that punishment of which we all have our part, then you are not true sons, but children of shame.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 9
text: And again, if the fathers of our flesh gave us punishment and had our respect, how much more will we be under the authority of the Father of spirits, and have life?

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 10
text: For they truly gave us punishment for a short time, as it seemed good to them; but he does it for our profit, so that we may become holy as he is.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 11
text: At the time all punishment seems to be pain and not joy: but after, those who have been trained by it get from it the peace-giving fruit of righteousness.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 12
text: For this cause let the hands which are hanging down be lifted up, and let the feeble knees be made strong,

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 13
text: And make straight roads for your feet, so that the feeble may not be turned out of the way, but may be made strong.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 14
text: Let your desire be for peace with all men, and to be made holy, without which no man may see the Lord;

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 15
text: Looking with care to see that no man among you in his behaviour comes short of the grace of God; for fear that some bitter root may come up to be a trouble to you, and that some of you may be made unclean by it;

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 16
text: And that there may not be any evil liver, or any man without respect for God, like Esau, who let his birthright go for a plate of food.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 17
text: For you have knowledge that even long after, when he was desiring the blessing for his heritage, he was turned away, though he made his request frequently and with weeping; because the past might not be changed.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 18
text: You have not come to a mountain which may be touched, and is burning with fire, and to a black cloud, and a dark smoke, and a violent wind,

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 19
text: And to the sound of a horn, and the voice of words, the hearers of which made request that not a word more might be said to them:

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 20
text: For the order which said, If the mountain is touched even by a beast, the beast is to be stoned, seemed hard to them;

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 21
text: And the vision was so overpowering that even Moses said, I am shaking and full of fear.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 22
text: But you have come to the mountain of Zion, to the place of the living God, to the Jerusalem which is in heaven, and to an army of angels which may not be numbered,

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 23
text: To the great meeting and church of the first of those who are named in heaven, and to God the judge of all, and to the spirits of good men made complete,

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 24
text: And to Jesus by whom the new agreement has been made between God and man, and to the sign of the blood which says better things than Abel's blood.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 25
text: See that you give ear to his voice which comes to you. For if those whose ears were shut to the voice which came to them on earth did not go free from punishment, what chance have we of going free if we give no attention to him whose voice comes from heaven?

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 26
text: Whose voice was the cause of the shaking of the earth; but now he has made an oath, saying, There will be still one more shaking, not only of the earth, but of heaven.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 27
text: And the words, Still one more, make it clear that there will be a taking away of those things which are shaking, as of things which are made, so that there may be only those things of which no shaking is possible.

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 28
text: If then, we have a kingdom which will never be moved, let us have grace, so that we may give God such worship as is pleasing to him with fear and respect:

title: Hebrews Chapter 12 Verse 29
text: For our God is an all-burning fire.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 1
text: Go on loving your brothers in the faith.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 2
text: Take care to keep open house: because in this way some have had angels as their guests, without being conscious of it.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 3
text: Keep in mind those who are in chains, as if you were chained with them, and those who are in trouble, as being yourselves in the body.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 4
text: Let married life be honoured among all of you and not made unclean; for men untrue in married life will be judged by God.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 5
text: Be free from the love of money and pleased with the things which you have; for he himself has said, I will be with you at all times.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 6
text: So that we say with a good heart, The Lord is my helper; I will have no fear: what is man able to do to me?

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 7
text: Keep in mind those who were over you, and who gave you the word of God; seeing the outcome of their way of life, let your faith be like theirs.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 8
text: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and for ever.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 9
text: Do not be turned away by different strange teachings, because it is good for your hearts to be made strong by grace, and not by meats, which were of no profit to those who took so much trouble over them.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 10
text: We have an altar from which those priests who are servants in the Tent may not take food.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 11
text: For the bodies of the beasts whose blood is taken into the holy place by the high priest as an offering for sin are burned outside the circle of the tents.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 12
text: For this reason Jesus was put to death outside the walls, so that he might make the people holy by his blood.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 13
text: Let us then go out to him outside the circle of the tents, taking his shame on ourselves.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 14
text: For here we have no fixed resting-place, but our search is for the one which is to come.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 15
text: Let us then make offerings of praise to God at all times through him, that is to say, the fruit of lips giving witness to his name.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 16
text: But go on doing good and giving to others, because God is well-pleased with such offerings.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 17
text: Give ear to those who are rulers over you, and do as they say: for they keep watch over your souls, ready to give an account of them; let them be able to do this with joy and not with grief, because that would be of no profit to you.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 18
text: Make prayers for us, for we are certain that our hearts are free from the sense of sin, desiring the right way of life in all things.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 19
text: I make this request more strongly, in the hope of coming back to you more quickly.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 20
text: Now may the God of peace, who made that great keeper of his flock, even our Lord Jesus, come back from the dead through the blood of the eternal agreement,

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 21
text: Make you full of every good work and ready to do all his desires, working in us whatever is pleasing in his eyes through Jesus Christ; and may the glory be given to him for ever and ever. So be it.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 22
text: But, brothers, take kindly the words which I have said for your profit; for I have not sent you a long letter.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 23
text: Our brother Timothy has been let out of prison; and if he comes here in a short time, he and I will come to you together.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 24
text: Give words of love from me to those who are rulers over you, and to all the saints. Those who are in Italy send you their love.

title: Hebrews Chapter 13 Verse 25
text: May grace be with you all.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, sends words of love to the twelve tribes of the Jews living in all parts of the earth.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Let it be all joy to you, my brothers, when you undergo tests of every sort;

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Because you have the knowledge that the testing of your faith gives you the power of going on in hope;

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: But let this power have its full effect, so that you may be made complete, needing nothing.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: But if any man among you is without wisdom, let him make his request to God, who gives freely to all without an unkind word, and it will be given to him.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: Let him make his request in faith, doubting nothing; for he who has doubt in his heart is like the waves of the sea, which are troubled by the driving of the wind.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: Let it not seem to such a man that he will get anything from the Lord;

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: For there is a division in his mind, and he is uncertain in all his ways.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: But let the brother of low position be glad that he is lifted up;

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: But the man of wealth, that he is made low; because like the flower of the grass he will come to his end.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: For when the sun comes up with its burning heat, the grass gets dry and the grace of its form is gone with the falling flower; so the man of wealth comes to nothing in his ways.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: There is a blessing on the man who undergoes testing; because, if he has God's approval, he will be given the crown of life, which the Lord has said he will give to those who have love for him.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: Let no man say when he is tested, I am tested by God; for it is not possible for God to be tested by evil, and he himself puts no man to such a test:

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: But every man is tested when he is turned out of the right way by the attraction of his desire.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: Then when its time comes, desire gives birth to sin; and sin, when it is of full growth, gives birth to death.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Do not be turned from the right way, dear brothers.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: Every good and true thing is given to us from heaven, coming from the Father of lights, with whom there is no change or any shade made by turning.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Of his purpose he gave us being, by his true word, so that we might be, in a sense, the first-fruits of all the things which he had made.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: You have knowledge of this, dear brothers. But let every man be quick in hearing, slow in words, slow to get angry;

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: For the righteousness of God does not come about by the wrath of man.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: For this reason, putting away all dirty behaviour and the overweight of evil, take into your souls without pride the word which, being planted there, is able to give you salvation.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: But be doers of the word, and not only hearers of it, blinding yourselves with false ideas.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Because if any man is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a glass;

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: For after looking at himself he goes away, and in a short time he has no memory of what he was like.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: But he who goes on looking into the true law which makes him free, being not a hearer without memory but a doer putting it into effect, this man will have a blessing on his acts.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 26
text: If a man seems to have religion and has no control over his tongue but lets himself be tricked by what is false, this man's religion is of no value.

title: James Chapter 1 Verse 27
text: The religion which is holy and free from evil in the eyes of our God and Father is this: to take care of children who have no fathers and of widows who are in trouble, and to keep oneself untouched by the world.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: My brothers, if you have the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory, do not take a man's position into account.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: For if a man comes into your Synagogue in fair clothing and with a gold ring, and a poor man comes in with dirty clothing,

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: And you do honour to the man in fair clothing and say, Come here and take this good place; and you say to the poor man, Take up your position there, or be seated at my feet;

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: Is there not a division in your minds? have you not become judges with evil thoughts?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: Give ear, my dear brothers; are not those who are poor in the things of this world marked out by God to have faith as their wealth, and for their heritage the kingdom which he has said he will give to those who have love for him?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: But you have put the poor man to shame. Are not the men of wealth rulers over you? do they not take you by force before their judges?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: Do they not say evil of the holy name which was given to you?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: But if you keep the greatest law of all, as it is given in the holy Writings, Have love for your neighbour as for yourself, you do well:

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: But if you take a man's position into account, you do evil, and are judged as evil-doers by the law.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: For anyone who keeps all the law, but makes a slip in one point, is judged to have gone against it all.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: For he who said, Do not be untrue in married life, is the same who said, Put no man to death. Now if you are not untrue in married life, but you put a man to death, the law is broken.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Let your words and your acts be those of men who are to be judged by the law which makes free.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: For the man who has had no mercy will be judged without mercy, but mercy takes pride in overcoming judging.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: What use is it, my brothers, for a man to say that he has faith, if he does nothing? will such a faith give him salvation?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: If a brother or a sister is without clothing and in need of the day's food,

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: And one of you says to them, Go in peace, be warm and full of food; but you do not give them the things of which their bodies have need, what profit is there in this?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Even so faith without works is dead.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: But a man may say, You have faith and I have works; let me see your faith without your works, and I will make my faith clear to you by my works.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: You have the belief that God is one, and you do well: the evil spirits have the same belief, shaking with fear.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: Do you not see, O foolish man, that faith without works is of no use?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: Was not the righteousness of Abraham our father judged by his works, when he made an offering of Isaac his son on the altar?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: You see that his faith was helping his works and was made complete by them;

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: And the holy Writings were put into effect which said, And Abraham had faith in God and it was put to his account as righteousness; and he was named the friend of God.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: You see that a man's righteousness is judged by his works and not by his faith only.

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: And in the same way, was not the righteousness of Rahab, the loose woman, judged by her works, when she took into her house those who were sent and let them go out by another way?

title: James Chapter 2 Verse 26
text: For as the body without the spirit is dead even so faith without works is dead.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Do not all be teachers, my brothers, because we teachers will be judged more hardly than others.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: For we all go wrong in a number of things. If a man never makes a slip in his talk, then he is a complete man and able to keep all his body in control.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Now if we put bits of iron into horses' mouths so that they may be guided by us, we have complete control of their bodies.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: And again ships, though they are so great and are moved by violent winds, are turned by a very small guiding-blade, at the impulse of the man who is using it.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: Even so the tongue is a small part of the body, but it takes credit for great things. How much wood may be lighted by a very little fire!

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: And the tongue is a fire; it is the power of evil placed in our bodies, making all the body unclean, putting the wheel of life on fire, and getting its fire from hell.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: For every sort of beast and bird and every living thing on earth and in the sea has been controlled by man and is under his authority;

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: But the tongue may not be controlled by man; it is an unresting evil, it is full of the poison of death.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: With it we give praise to our Lord and Father; and with it we put a curse on men who are made in God's image.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: Out of the same mouth comes blessing and cursing. My brothers, it is not right for these things to be so.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: Does the fountain send from the same outlet sweet and bitter water?

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: Is a fig-tree able to give us olives, my brothers, or do we get figs from a vine, or sweet water from the salt sea?

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Who has wisdom and good sense among you? let him make his works clear by a life of gentle wisdom.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: But if you have bitter envy in your heart and the desire to get the better of others, have no pride in this, talking falsely against what is true.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: This wisdom is not from heaven, but is of the earth and the flesh and the Evil One.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: For where envy is, and the desire to get the better of others, there is no order, but every sort of evil-doing.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: But the wisdom which is from heaven is first holy, then gentle, readily giving way in argument, full of peace and mercy and good works, not doubting, not seeming other than it is.

title: James Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: And the fruit of righteousness is planted in peace for those who make peace.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: What is the cause of wars and fighting among you? is it not in your desires which are at war in your bodies?

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: You are burning with desire, and have not your desire, so you put men to death; you are full of envy, and you are not able to get your desire, so you are fighting and making war; you have not your desire, because you do not make request for it.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: You make your request but you do not get it, because your request has been wrongly made, desiring the thing only so that you may make use of it for your pleasure.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: O you who are false to God, do you not see that the friends of this world are not God's friends? Every man desiring to be a friend of this world makes himself a hater of God.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: Or does it seem to you that it is for nothing that the holy Writings say, The spirit which God put into our hearts has a strong desire for us?

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: But he gives more grace. So that the Writings say, God is against the men of pride, but he gives grace to those who make themselves low before him.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: For this cause be ruled by God; but make war on the Evil One and he will be put to flight before you.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: Come near to God and he will come near to you. Make your hands clean, you evil-doers; put away deceit from your hearts, you false in mind.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Be troubled, with sorrow and weeping; let your laughing be turned to sorrow and your joy to grief.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Make yourselves low in the eyes of the Lord and you will be lifted up by him.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: Do not say evil against one another, my brothers. He who says evil against his brother or makes himself his brother's judge, says evil against the law and is judging the law: and in judging the law you become, not a doer of the law but a judge.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: There is only one judge and law-giver, even he who has the power of salvation and of destruction; but who are you to be your neighbour's judge?

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: How foolish it is to say, Today or tomorrow we will go into this town, and be there for a year and do business there and get wealth:

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: When you are not certain what will take place tomorrow. What is your life? It is a mist, which is seen for a little time and then is gone.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: But the right thing to say would be, If it is the Lord's pleasure and if we are still living, we will do this and that.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: But now you go on glorying in your pride: and all such glorying is evil.

title: James Chapter 4 Verse 17
text: The man who has knowledge of how to do good and does not do it, to him it is sin.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 1
text: Come now, you men of wealth, give yourselves to weeping and crying because of the bitter troubles which are coming to you.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 2
text: Your wealth is unclean and insects have made holes in your clothing.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 3
text: Your gold and your silver are wasted and their waste will be a witness against you, burning into your flesh. You have put by your store in the last days.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 4
text: See, the money which you falsely kept back from the workers cutting the grass in your field, is crying out against you; and the cries of those who took in your grain have come to the ears of the Lord of armies.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 5
text: You have been living delicately on earth and have taken your pleasure; you have made your hearts fat for a day of destruction.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 6
text: You have given your decision against the upright man and have put him to death. He puts up no fight against you.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 7
text: Go on waiting calmly, my brothers, till the coming of the Lord, like the farmer waiting for the good fruit of the earth till the early and late rains have come.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 8
text: Be as calm in your waiting; let your hearts be strong: because the coming of the Lord is near.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 9
text: Say no hard things against one another, brothers, so that you will not be judged; see, the judge is waiting at the doors.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 10
text: Take as an example of pain nobly undergone and of strength in trouble, the prophets who gave to men the words of the Lord.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 11
text: We say that those men who have gone through pain are happy: you have the story of Job and the troubles through which he went and have seen that the Lord was full of pity and mercy in the end.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 12
text: But most of all, my brothers, do not take oaths, not by the heaven, or by the earth, or by any other thing: but let your Yes be Yes, and your No be No: so that you may not be judged.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 13
text: Is anyone among you in trouble? let him say prayers. Is anyone glad? let him make a song of praise.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 14
text: Is anyone among you ill? let him send for the rulers of the church; and let them say prayers over him, putting oil on him in the name of the Lord.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 15
text: And by the prayer of faith the man who is ill will be made well, and he will be lifted up by the Lord, and for any sin which he has done he will have forgiveness.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 16
text: So then, make a statement of your sins to one another, and say prayers for one another so that you may be made well. The prayer of a good man is full of power in its working.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 17
text: Elijah was a man of flesh and blood as we are, and he made a strong prayer that there might be no rain; and there was no rain on the earth for three years and six months.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 18
text: And he made another prayer, and the heaven sent down rain and the earth gave her fruit.

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 19
text: My brothers, if one of you has gone out of the way of the true faith and another has made him see his error,

title: James Chapter 5 Verse 20
text: Be certain that he through whom a sinner has been turned from the error of his way, keeps a soul from death and is the cause of forgiveness for sins without number.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 1
text: Peter, an Apostle of Jesus Christ, to the saints who are living in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 2
text: Who, through the purpose of God, have been made holy by the Spirit, disciples of Jesus, made clean by his blood: May you have grace and peace in full measure.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 3
text: Praise be to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who through his great mercy has given us a new birth and a living hope by the coming again of Jesus Christ from the dead,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 4
text: And a heritage fair, holy and for ever new, waiting in heaven for you,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 5
text: Who, by the power of God are kept, through faith, for that salvation, which will be seen at the last day.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 6
text: You have cause for great joy in this, though it may have been necessary for you to be troubled for a little time, being tested in all sorts of ways,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 7
text: So that the true metal of your faith, being of much greater value than gold (which, though it comes to an end, is tested by fire), may come to light in praise and glory and honour, at the revelation of Jesus Christ:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 8
text: To whom your love is given, though you have not seen him; and the faith which you have in him, though you do not see him now, gives you joy greater than words and full of glory:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 9
text: For so you have the true end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 10
text: For the prophets who gave the news of the grace which would come to you, made search with all care for knowledge of this salvation;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 11
text: Attempting to see what sort of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them was pointing to, when it gave witness to the pains which Christ would undergo and the glories which would come after them.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 12
text: And it was made clear to those prophets that they were God's servants not for themselves but for you, to give you word of the things which have now come to your ears from the preachers of the good news through the Holy Spirit sent down from heaven; things which even angels have a desire to see.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 13
text: So make your minds ready, and keep on the watch, hoping with all your power for the grace which is to come to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 14
text: Like children ruled by God, do not go back to the old desires of the time when you were without knowledge:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 15
text: But be holy in every detail of your lives, as he, whose servants you are, is holy;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 16
text: Because it has been said in the Writings, You are to be holy, for I am holy.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 17
text: And if you give the name of Father to him who, judging every man by his acts, has no respect for a man's position, then go in fear while you are on this earth:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 18
text: Being conscious that you have been made free from that foolish way of life which was your heritage from your fathers, not through a payment of things like silver or gold which come to destruction,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 19
text: But through holy blood, like that of a clean and unmarked lamb, even the blood of Christ:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 20
text: Who was marked out by God before the making of the world, but was caused to be seen in these last times for you,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 21
text: Who through him have faith in God who took him up again from the dead into glory; so that your faith and hope might be in God.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 22
text: And as you have made your souls clean, being ruled by what is true, and loving one another without deceit, see that your love is warm and from the heart:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 23
text: Because you have had a new birth, not from the seed of man, but from eternal seed, through the word of a living and unchanging God.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 24
text: For it is said, All flesh is like grass, and all its glory like the flower of the grass. The grass becomes dry and the flower dead:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 1 Verse 25
text: But the word of the Lord is eternal. And this is the word of the good news which was given to you.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 1
text: So putting away all wrongdoing, and all tricks and deceits and envies and evil talk,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 2
text: Be full of desire for the true milk of the word, as babies at their mothers' breasts, so that you may go on to salvation;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 3
text: If you have had a taste of the grace of the Lord:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 4
text: To whom you come, as to a living stone, not honoured by men, but of great and special value to God;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 5
text: You, as living stones, are being made into a house of the spirit, a holy order of priests, making those offerings of the spirit which are pleasing to God through Jesus Christ.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 6
text: Because it is said in the Writings, See, I am placing a keystone in Zion, of great and special value; and the man who has faith in him will not be put to shame.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 7
text: And the value is for you who have faith; but it is said for those without faith, The very stone which the builders put on one side, was made the chief stone of the building;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 8
text: And, A stone of falling, a rock of trouble; the word is the cause of their fall, because they go against it, and this was the purpose of God.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 9
text: But you are a special people, a holy nation, priests and kings, a people given up completely to God, so that you may make clear the virtues of him who took you out of the dark into the light of heaven.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 10
text: In the past you were not a people, but now you are the people of God; then there was no mercy for you, but now mercy has been given to you.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 11
text: My loved ones, I make this request with all my heart, that, as those for whom this world is a strange country, you will keep yourselves from the desires of the flesh which make war against the soul;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 12
text: Being of good behaviour among the Gentiles; so that though they say now that you are evil-doers, they may see your good works and give glory to God when he comes to be their judge.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 13
text: Keep all the laws of men because of the Lord; those of the king, who is over all,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 14
text: And those of the rulers who are sent by him for the punishment of evil-doers and for the praise of those who do well.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 15
text: Because it is God's pleasure that foolish and narrow-minded men may be put to shame by your good behaviour:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 16
text: As those who are free, not using your free position as a cover for wrongdoing, but living as the servants of God;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 17
text: Have respect for all, loving the brothers, fearing God, honouring the king.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 18
text: Servants, take orders from your masters with all respect; not only if they are good and gentle, but even if they are bad-humoured.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 19
text: For it is a sign of grace if a man, desiring to do right in the eyes of God, undergoes pain as punishment for something which he has not done.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 20
text: What credit is it if, when you have done evil, you take your punishment quietly? but if you are given punishment for doing right, and take it quietly, this is pleasing to God.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 21
text: This is God's purpose for you: because Jesus himself underwent punishment for you, giving you an example, so that you might go in his footsteps:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 22
text: Who did no evil, and there was no deceit in his mouth:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 23
text: To sharp words he gave no sharp answer; when he was undergoing pain, no angry word came from his lips; but he put himself into the hands of the judge of righteousness:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 24
text: He took our sins on himself, giving his body to be nailed on the tree, so that we, being dead to sin, might have a new life in righteousness, and by his wounds we have been made well.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 2 Verse 25
text: Because, like sheep, you had gone out of the way; but now you have come back to him who keeps watch over your souls.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 1
text: Wives, be ruled by your husbands; so that even if some of them give no attention to the word, their hearts may be changed by the behaviour of their wives,

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 2
text: When they see your holy behaviour in the fear of God.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 3
text: Do not let your ornaments be those of the body such as dressing of the hair, or putting on of jewels of gold or fair clothing;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 4
text: But let them be those of the unseen man of the heart, the ever-shining ornament of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is of great price in the eyes of God.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 5
text: And these were the ornaments of the holy women of the past, whose hope was in God, being ruled by their husbands:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 6
text: As Sarah was ruled by Abraham, naming him lord; whose children you are if you do well, and are not put in fear by any danger.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 7
text: And you husbands, give thought to your way of life with your wives, giving honour to the woman who is the feebler vessel, but who has an equal part in the heritage of the grace of life; so that you may not be kept from prayer.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 8
text: Last of all, see that you are all in agreement; feeling for one another, loving one another like brothers, full of pity, without pride:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 9
text: Not giving back evil for evil, or curse for curse, but in place of cursing, blessing; because this is the purpose of God for you that you may have a heritage of blessing.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 10
text: For it is said, Let the man who has a love of life, desiring to see good days, keep his tongue from evil and his lips from words of deceit:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 11
text: And let him be turned from evil and do good; searching for peace and going after it with all his heart.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 12
text: For the eyes of the Lord are on the upright, and his ears are open to their prayers: but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 13
text: Who will do you any damage if you keep your minds fixed on what is good?

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 14
text: But you are happy if you undergo pain because of righteousness; have no part in their fear and do not be troubled;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 15
text: But give honour to Christ in your hearts as your Lord; and be ready at any time when you are questioned about the hope which is in you, to give an answer in the fear of the Lord and without pride;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 16
text: Being conscious that you have done no wrong; so that those who say evil things about your good way of life as Christians may be put to shame.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 17
text: Because if it is God's purpose for you to undergo pain, it is better to do so for well-doing than for evil-doing.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 18
text: Because Christ once went through pain for sins, the upright one taking the place of sinners, so that through him we might come back to God; being put to death in the flesh, but given life in the Spirit;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 19
text: By whom he went to the spirits in prison, preaching to those

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 20
text: Who, in the days of Noah, went against God's orders; but God in his mercy kept back the punishment, while Noah got ready the ark, in which a small number, that is to say eight persons, got salvation through water:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 21
text: And baptism, of which this is an image, now gives you salvation, not by washing clean the flesh, but by making you free from the sense of sin before God, through the coming again of Jesus Christ from the dead;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 3 Verse 22
text: Who has gone into heaven, and is at the right hand of God, angels and authorities and powers having been put under his rule.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 1
text: So that as Jesus was put to death in the flesh, do you yourselves be of the same mind; for the death of the flesh puts an end to sin;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 2
text: So that you may give the rest of your lives in the flesh, not to the desires of men, but to the purpose of God.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 3
text: Because for long enough, in times past, we have been living after the way of the Gentiles, given up to the desires of the flesh, to drinking and feasting and loose behaviour and unclean worship of images;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 4
text: And they are wondering that you no longer go with them in this violent wasting of life, and are saying evil things of you:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 5
text: But they will have to give an account of themselves to him who is ready to be the judge of the living and the dead.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 6
text: For this was the reason why the good news of Jesus was given even to the dead, so that they might be judged as men in the flesh, but might be living before God in the spirit.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 7
text: But the end of all things is near: so be serious in your behaviour and keep on the watch with prayer;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 8
text: And most of all be warm in your love for one another; because in love there is forgiveness for sins without number:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 9
text: Keep open house for all with a glad heart;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 10
text: Making distribution among one another of whatever has been given to you, like true servants of the unmeasured grace of God;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 11
text: If anyone has anything to say, let it be as the words of God; if anyone has the desire to be the servant of others, let him do it in the strength which is given by God; so that in all things God may have the glory through Jesus Christ, whose are the glory and the power for ever.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 12
text: Dear brothers, do not be surprised, as if it was something strange, if your faith is tested as by fire:

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 13
text: But be glad that you are given a part in the pains of Christ; so that at the revelation of his glory you may have great joy.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 14
text: If men say evil things of you because of the name of Christ, happy are you; for the Spirit of glory and of God is resting on you.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 15
text: Let no one among you undergo punishment as a taker of life, or as a thief, or as an evil-doer, or as one who is over-interested in other men's business;

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 16
text: But if he undergoes punishment as a Christian, that is no shame to him; let him give glory to God in this name.

title: 1 Peter Chapter 4 Verse 17
